attributes.action: Investigate Belfast City Council over Lennox case
attributes.additional_details:
We the undersigned are requesting an independent inquiry into Belfast City Council's (BCC) handling of Lennox, the Labrador/Bulldog, recently euthanised by BCC under the Dangerous Dogs Act (DDA).

Lennox was euthanised for being a "pit-bull type" of dog. DNA evidence to the contrary was not considered, nor was his history which was incident-free. We believe that BCC exploited the DDA without discretion for Lennox's history or consideration for external expert testimony.

rejection.details: These are transferred matters and therefore the responsibility of the Northern Ireland Executive.  It is also open to the public to consider if the Northern Ireland Ombudsman/Commissioner of Complaints might have a role in investigation of any reports of maladministration.
